ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.1.2_0: At that time in a certain monastery in the Kosalan country a number of monks who were friends had entered rainy-season residence together.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.1.4_0: “How can we remain united and in harmony, have a comfortable rains residence, and get almsfood without trouble?”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.2.2_0: “If we neither converse each other, we wouldn’t have a discussion.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.2.3_0: Whoever returns first from almsround in the village should prepare the seats and set out a foot-stool, a foot-scraper, and water for washing the feet. He should clean the bowl for leftovers and set it out, and put out water for drinking and water for washing.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.3.1_0: Whoever returns last from almsround may eat whatever is leftover, or he should discard it where there are no cultivated plants or in water without life.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.3.2_0: He should put away the seats and also the foot-stool, the foot-scraper, and the water for washing the feet. He should clean the bowl for leftovers and put it away, put away the water for drinking and the water for washing, and sweep the dining hall.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.4.1_0: Whoever sees that the pot for drinking water, the pot for washing water, or the waterpot in the restroom is empty should fill it.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.4.2_0: If he can’t do it by himself, he should call someone over by hand signal and they should fill it together.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.4.3_0: He should not speak because of that.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.4.4_0: In this way we’ll remain united and in harmony, have a comfortable rains residence, and get almsfood without trouble.”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.5.1_0: Then those monks did not chat one another.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.5.2_0: Whoever returns first from almsround in the village should prepare the seats and set out a foot-stool, a foot-scraper, and water for washing the feet. He cleans the bowl for leftovers and sets out water for drinking and water for washing.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.6.1_0: If there’s anything left over, whoever returns last eats it if they like. Otherwise they throw it out where there is little that grows, or drop it into water that has no living creatures.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.6.2_0: He puts away the seats and also the foot-stool, the foot scraper, and the water for washing the feet. He cleans the bowl for leftovers and puts it away, puts away the water for drinking and the water for washing, and sweeps the dining hall.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.7.1_0: If someone sees that the pot of water for washing, drinking, or the toilet is empty they set it up.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.7.2_0: If he can’t do it by himself, he summons another with a wave of the hand, and they set it up by lifting it with their hands. But they don’t break into speech for that reason.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.8.1_0: It’s been a long time to go to see the Buddha.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.8.2_0: So when they had competed the rains residence and the three months had elapsed, those monks put their dwellings in order, took their bowls and robes, and left for Sāvatthī.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.8.3_0: When he eventually arrived at Sāvatthī, they went to the Buddha in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery. They bowed to the Buddha and sat down.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.8.4_0: Since it is the custom for Buddhas to greet newly arrived monks,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.9.2_0: “I hope you are keeping well, monks, I hope you’re comfortable.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.9.3_0: I hope you had a comfortable rains residence, in concord and harmony, without dispute, and that you had no trouble getting almsfood?”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.9.4_0: “I can bear up, Fortunate One, I can carry on, Fortunate One,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.9.5_0: we had a comfortable rains residence, in concord and harmony, without dispute, and we had no trouble getting almsfood.”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.10.1_0: When Buddhas know what is going on, sometimes they ask and sometimes not;
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.10.2_0: they know the right time to ask and the right time not to ask.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.10.3_0: Buddhas ask when it is beneficial, not when it is unbeneficial,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.10.4_0: by the Realized Ones are incapable of doing what is unbeneficial.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.10.5_0: Buddhas question the monks for two reasons: to give a teaching or to lay down a training rule.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.10.6_0: And the Buddha said to those monks, “In what way, monks, did you have a comfortable rains residence, without having any trouble getting almsfood?”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.11.1_0: And they told him what had happened.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.11.3_0: ‘How can we remain united and in harmony, have a comfortable rains residence, and get almsfood without trouble?’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.11.5_0: ‘If we neither converse each other, we wouldn’t have a discussion.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.11.6_0: Whoever returns first from almsround in the village should prepare the seats and set out a foot-stool, a foot-scraper, and water for washing the feet. He should clean the bowl for leftovers and set it out, and put out water for drinking and water for washing.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.11.7_0: Whoever returns last from almsround may eat whatever is leftover, or he should discard it where there are no cultivated plants or in water without life.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.11.8_0: He should put away the seats and also the foot-stool, the foot-scraper, and the water for washing the feet. He should clean the bowl for leftovers and put it away, put away the water for drinking and the water for washing, and sweep the dining hall.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.11.9_0: Whoever sees that the pot for drinking water, the pot for washing water, or the waterpot in the restroom is empty should fill it.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.11.10_0: If he can’t do it by himself, he should call someone over by hand signal and they should fill it together.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.11.11_0: He should not speak because of that.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.11.12_0: In this way we’ll remain united and in harmony, have a comfortable rains residence, and get almsfood without trouble.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.11.13_0: But we didn’t submit even though each other.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.11.14_0: Whoever returns first from almsround in the village should prepare the seats and set out a foot-stool, a foot-scraper, and water for washing the feet. He cleans the bowl for leftovers and sets out water for drinking and water for washing.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.11.15_0: If there’s anything left over, whoever returns last eats it if they like. If the water is kept on the foot-stool, or where there are no cultivated plants for leftovers and puts it away, puts away the water for drinking and the water for washing, and sweps the dining hall.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.11.16_0: If someone sees that the pot of water for washing, drinking, or the toilet is empty they set it up.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.11.17_0: If he can’t do it by himself, he summons another with a wave of the hand, and they set it up by lifting it with their hands. But they don’t break into speech for that reason.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.11.18_0: In this way we’re united and in harmony, have a comfortable rains residence, and we had no trouble getting almsfood.”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.12.1_0: The Buddha said to the monks,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.12.2_0: “While they dwelt in discomfort these foolish men claim they were dwelling in comfort.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.12.3_0: While they dwelt together like animals, they claim they were dwelling in comfort.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.12.4_0: While they dwelt together like sheep, they claim they were dwelling in comfort.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.12.5_0: While they dwelt together like enemies, they claim they were dwelling in comfort.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.12.6_0: How can these foolish men take a vow of silence, as do the ascetics of other religions?
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.13.1_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.13.2_0: after criticizing them, he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.13.3_0: “You should not take a vow of silence, as do the ascetics of other religions.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.13.4_0: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.13.5_0: When you have completed the rainy-season residence, you should invite the monks to correct you in regard to three things:
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.13.6_0: what has been seen, what has been heard, or what is suspected.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.13.7_0: This will help you live with one another in the proper way, help you clear yourself of offenses, and help you give priority to the training.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.14.1_0: And it should be done like this.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.14.2_0: A competent and capable monk should then inform the Sangha:
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.14.3_0: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.14.5_0: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should do the invitation procedure.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.14.6_0: The senior monk should put his upper robe over one shoulder, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say:
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.14.7_0: ʻI invite the Sangha to correct me concerning what you have seen, what you have heard, and what you suspect.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.14.8_0: Please correct me, Venerables, out of compassion.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.14.9_0: If I see a fault, I will make amends.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.14.10_0: For the second time, I invite the Sangha to correct me concerning what you have seen, what you have heard, and what you suspect.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.14.11_0: Please correct me, Venerables, out of compassion.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.14.12_0: If I see a fault, I will make amends.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.14.13_0: For the third time, I invite the Sangha to correct me concerning what you have seen, what you have heard, and what you suspect.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.14.14_0: Please correct me, Venerables, out of compassion.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.14.15_0: If I see a fault, I will make amends.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.14.16_0: The junior monk should put his upper robe over one shoulder, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say:
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.14.17_0: ʻI invite the Sangha to correct me concerning what you have seen, what you have heard, and what you suspect.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.14.18_0: Please correct me, Venerables, out of compassion.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.14.19_0: If I see a fault, I will make amends.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.14.20_0: For the second time I invite the Sangha to correct me concerning what you have seen, what you have heard, and what you suspect. Please correct me, Venerables, out of compassion. If I see a fault, I will make amends.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.14.21_0: For the third time I invite the Sangha to correct me concerning what you have seen, what you have heard, and what you suspect.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.14.22_0: Please correct me, Venerables, out of compassion.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:1.14.23_0: If I see a fault, I will make amends.’”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:2.1.1_0: Soon afterwards the monks from the group of six remained seated while the senior monks were inviting correction, squatting on their heels.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:2.1.2_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Udāyī,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:2.1.3_0: “How can the monks from the group of six act like this?”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:2.1.4_0: They then told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned them:
ai-pli-tv-kd4:2.1.5_0: “Is it true, monks, that the monks from the group of six were acting like this?”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:2.1.8_0: “... How can those foolish men act like this?
ai-pli-tv-kd4:2.1.9_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...
ai-pli-tv-kd4:2.1.11_0: he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd4:2.1.12_0: “You should not remain seated while the senior monks are inviting correction, squatting on their heels.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:2.1.13_0: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:2.1.14_0: Everyone should squat on their heels during the invitation procedure.”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:2.2.1_0: Now at that time the senior elder was sitting in order to invite correction, where he was waiting for the hut to square.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:2.2.3_0: “You should squat on your heels until you have invited correction. Once you have invited, you may sit down.”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.1.6_0: These are the two invitation procedure.”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.2.5_0: The invitation procedure that is illegitimate but has an incomplete assembly;
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.2.6_0: The invitation procedure that is illegitimate but has a complete assembly;
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.2.7_0: The invitation procedure that is legitimate but has an incomplete assembly;
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.2.8_0: The invitation procedure that is legitimate but has a complete assembly;
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.2.13_0: and third of these should not be done;
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.2.16_0: I have allowed such a procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.2.17_0: Therefore, monks, you should train like this: ʻWe will do invitation procedures that are legitimate and have a complete assembly.’”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.3.1_0: The Buddha said to the monks,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.3.3_0: for the Sangha to invite correction.”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.3.5_0: “Venerable Sir, there’s a sick monk. He hasn’t come.”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.3.6_0: “I allow a sick monk to pass on his invitation.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.3.7_0: And it should be passed on like this.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.3.8_0: The sick monk should approach a monk, put his upper robe over one shoulder, and squat on his heels. He should then raise his joined palms and say,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.3.9_0: ʻI pass on my invitation; please convey my invitation; please announce my invitation; please invite correction on my behalf.’ If he makes this understood by body, by speech, or by body and speech, then the invitation has been passed on.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.3.10_0: If he doesn’t make this understood by body, by speech, or by body and speech, then the invitation hasn’t been passed on.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.4.1_0: If this works out, all is well.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.4.2_0: If not, then the sick monk should be brought into the midst of the Sangha together with his bed or bench. They can then do the invitation procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.4.3_0: But if the one who is nursing the sick monk says,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.4.4_0: ʻIf we move him, his illness will get worse, or he’ll die,’ then the sick monk shouldn’t be moved.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.4.5_0: The Sangha should go to where the sick monk is and do the invitation procedure there.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.4.6_0: But you should not do the invitation procedure with an incomplete Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.4.7_0: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.1_0: “If, after the invitation has been passed on to him, the monk who is conveying the invitation departs right there, then the invitation should be passed on to another.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.2_0: If, after the invitation has been passed on to him, the monk who is conveying the invitation disrobes right there,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.4_0: admits that he’s a novice monk,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.5_0: admits right there that he’s renounced the training,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.6_0: admits that he’s committed the worst kind of offense,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.9_0: admits that he’s overwhelmed by pain,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.10_0: admits that he’s been ejected for not recognizing an offense,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.11_0: admits that he’s been ejected for not making amends for an offense,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.12_0: admits that he’s been ejected for not giving up a bad view,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.14_0: admits that he’s living in the community by theft,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.15_0: admits that he has previously left to join the ascetics of another religion,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.19_0: admits that he’s a murderer of a perfected one,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.20_0: admits right there that he has raped a nun ...
ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.21_0: admits that he has caused a schism in the Sangha,

ai-pli-tv-kd4:3.5.77_0: On the invitation day, if the Sangha has business to be done, then anyone passing on his invitation should also give his consent.”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:4.1.1_0: At one time on the invitation day a certain monk was seized by his relatives.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:4.1.3_0: “If on the invitation day a monk is seized by his relatives,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:4.1.4_0: The relatives should say to them,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:4.1.5_0: ʻPlease release this monk for a short time, so that he invitation procedure.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:4.2.1_0: If this works out, all is well.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:4.2.2_0: If not, they should say to those relatives,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:4.2.3_0: ʻPlease step to one side for a moment while this monk passes on his invitation.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:4.2.4_0: If this works out, all is well.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:4.2.5_0: If not, they should say to those relatives,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:4.2.6_0: ʻPlease take this monk outside the monastic boundary for a short time while the Sangha does the invitation procedure.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:4.2.7_0: If this works out, all is well.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:4.2.8_0: If not, you should not do the invitation procedure with an incomplete Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:4.2.9_0: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

ai-pli-tv-kd4:4.3.5_0: The monks should correct those monks,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:4.3.6_0: ʻPlease release this monk for a short time, so that he invitation procedure.’

ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.1.1_0: At one time on the invitation day there were five monks staying in a certain monastery.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.1.3_0: that the Buddha had laid down a rule
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.1.4_0: that the invitation procedure should be done with a sangha.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.1.6_0: How should we do the invitation procedure?”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.1.8_0: “When there are five of you, you should do the invitation procedure in the Sangha.”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.2.1_0: At one time on the invitation day there were four monks staying in a certain monastery.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.2.3_0: “The Buddha has instructed that the invitation procedure should be done in the Sangha when there are five monks.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.2.4_0: But there’s only four of us.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.2.5_0: How should we do the invitation procedure?”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.2.7_0: “When there are four of you, you should do the invitation procedure with one another.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.3.1_0: And it should be done like this.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.3.2_0: A competent and capable monk should inform those monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.3.3_0: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask you to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.3.5_0: If it seems appropriate to the venerables, we should do the invitation procedure with one another.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.3.6_0: The most senior monk should put his upper robe over one shoulder, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say to the other monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.3.7_0: ʻI invite you to correct me concerning what you have seen, what you have heard, and what you suspect.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.3.8_0: Please correct me, Venerables, out of compassion.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.3.9_0: If I see a fault, I will make amends.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.3.11_0: For the third time, I invite you to correct me concerning what you have seen, what you have heard, and what you suspect.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.3.12_0: Please correct me, Venerables, out of compassion.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.3.13_0: If I see a fault, I will make amends.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.3.14_0: The junior monk should put his upper robe over one shoulder, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say to the other monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.3.15_0: ʻI invite the venerables to correct me concerning what you have seen, what you have heard, and what you suspect.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.3.16_0: Please correct me, Venerables, out of compassion.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.3.17_0: If I see a fault, I will make amends.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.3.19_0: For the third time I invite the venerables to correct me concerning what you have seen, what you have heard, and what you suspect.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.3.20_0: Please correct me, Venerables, out of compassion.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.3.21_0: If I see a fault, I will make amends.’”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.4.1_0: At one time on the invitation day there were three monks staying in a certain monastery.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.4.3_0: “The Buddha has instructed that the invitation procedure should be done in the Sangha when there are five monks and with one another when there are five monks.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.4.4_0: But there’s only three of us.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.4.5_0: How should we do the invitation procedure?”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.4.7_0: “When there are three of you, you should do the invitation procedure with one another.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.4.8_0: And it should be done like this.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.4.9_0: A competent and capable monk should inform those monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.4.10_0: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask you to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.4.12_0: If it seems appropriate to the venerables, we should do the invitation procedure with one another.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.4.13_0: The most senior monk should put his upper robe over one shoulder, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say to the other monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.4.14_0: ʻI invite you to correct me concerning what you have seen, what you have heard, and what you suspect.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.4.15_0: Please correct me, Venerables, out of compassion.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.4.16_0: If I see a fault, I will make amends.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.4.18_0: For the third time, I invite you to correct me concerning what you have seen, what you have heard, and what you suspect.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.4.19_0: Please correct me, Venerables, out of compassion.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.4.20_0: If I see a fault, I will make amends.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.4.21_0: The junior monk should put his upper robe over one shoulder, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say to the other monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.4.22_0: ʻI invite the venerables to correct me concerning what you have seen, what you have heard, and what you suspect.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.4.23_0: Please correct me, Venerables, out of compassion.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.4.24_0: If I see a fault, I will make amends.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.4.26_0: For the third time I invite the venerables to correct me concerning what you have seen, what you have heard, and what you suspect.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.4.27_0: Please correct me, Venerables, out of compassion.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.4.28_0: If I see a fault, I will make amends.’”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.5.1_0: At one time on the invitation day there were two monks staying in a certain monastery.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.5.3_0: “The Buddha has instructed that the invitation procedure should be done in the Sangha when there are five monks and with one another when there are three or four.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.5.4_0: But there’s only two of us.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.5.5_0: How should we do the invitation procedure?”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.5.7_0: “When there are two of you, you should do the invitation procedure with each other.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.6.1_0: And it should be done like this.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.6.2_0: The senior monk should put his upper robe over one shoulder, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say to the junior monk:
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.6.3_0: ʻI invite you to correct me concerning what you have seen, what you have heard, and what you suspect.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.6.4_0: Please correct me, Venerable, out of compassion.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.6.5_0: If I see a fault, I will make amends.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.6.7_0: For the third time, I invite you to correct me concerning what you have seen, what you have heard, and what you suspect.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.6.8_0: Please correct me, Venerable, out of compassion.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.6.9_0: If I see a fault, I will make amends.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.6.10_0: The junior monk should put his upper robe over one shoulder, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say to the senior monk:
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.6.11_0: ʻI invite the venerable to correct me concerning what you have seen, what you have heard, and what you suspect.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.6.12_0: Please correct me, Venerable, out of compassion.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.6.13_0: If I see a fault, I will make amends.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.6.15_0: For the third time I invite the venerable to correct me concerning what you have seen, what you have heard, and what you suspect.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.6.16_0: Please correct me, Venerable, out of compassion.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.6.17_0: If I see a fault, I will make amends.’”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.7.1_0: At one time on the invitation day a monk was staying in a certain monastery by himself.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.7.3_0: “The Buddha has instructed that the invitation procedure should be done in the Sangha when there are five monks and with one another when there are two, three, or four.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.7.5_0: How should I do the invitation procedure?”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.8.1_0: “On the invitation day it may happen that a monk is staying by himself in a certain monastery.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.8.2_0: That monk should sweep whatever place the monks normally go to: whether the assembly hall, under a roof-cover, or at the foot of a tree. He should set out water for drinking and water for washing, should prepare a seat, light a lamp, and sit down.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.8.3_0: If other monks come, he should do the invitation procedure with them.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.8.4_0: If not, he should determine: ʻToday is my invitation procedure.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.8.5_0: If he doesn’t make a determination, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.9.1_0: Wherever five monks are staying together, four shouldn’t do the invitation procedure in the Sangha while bringing the invitation of one.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.9.2_0: If you do it in this way, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.9.3_0: Wherever four monks are staying together, three shouldn’t do the invitation procedure with one another while bringing the invitation of one.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.9.4_0: If you do it in this way, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.9.5_0: Wherever three monks are staying together, two shouldn’t do the invitation procedure with each other while bringing the invitation of one.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.9.6_0: If you do it in this way, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.9.7_0: Wherever two monks are staying together, one shouldn’t make a determination while bringing the invitation of one.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:5.9.8_0: If you do make determination in this way, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.1.1_0: At one time on the invitation day a certain monk had committed an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.1.3_0: that the Buddha had laid down a rule
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.1.4_0: that one shouldn’t invite correction if one has an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.1.8_0: “On the invitation day it may happen that a monk has committed an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.1.9_0: He should approach a single monk, put his upper robe over one shoulder, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.1.10_0: ‘I have committed such-and-such an offense. I confess it.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.1.15_0: On the invitation day it may happen that a monk is unsure if he’s committed an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.1.16_0: He should approach a single monk, put his upper robe over one shoulder, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.1.17_0: ‘I’m unsure if I’ve committed such-and-such an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.1.18_0: I will make amends for it when I’m sure.’ They can then do the invitation procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.1.19_0: You shouldn’t allow this to create an obstacle to the doing of the invitation procedure.”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.2.1_0: At one time a monk remembered an offense while the invitation procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.2.3_0: that the Buddha had laid down a rule
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.2.4_0: that one shouldn’t invite correction if one has an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.2.8_0: “It may happen that a monk remembers an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.2.9_0: He should say to a monk sitting next to him,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.2.11_0: Once this meeting is finished, I’ll make amends for it.’ They can then continue the invitation procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.2.12_0: You shouldn’t allow this to create an obstacle to the doing of the invitation procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.3.1_0: It may happen during the invitation procedure that a monk becomes unsure if he’s committed an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.3.2_0: He should say to a monk sitting next to him,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.3.3_0: ‘I’m unsure if I’ve committed such-and-such an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.3.4_0: I will make amends for it when I’m sure.’ They can then do the invitation procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.3.5_0: You shouldn’t allow this to create an obstacle to the doing of the invitation procedure.”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.3.6.1_0: At one time on the invitation day the whole sangha in a certain monastery had committed the same offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.3.8_0: that the Buddha had laid down a rule
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.3.9_0: that one shouldn’t confess or receive the confession of shared offenses.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.3.10_0: and the whole sangha has committed the same offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.3.11_0: So what should we do now?”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.3.13_0: “On the invitation day it may happen that the whole sangha in a certain monastery has committed the same offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.3.14_0: They should straightaway send one monk to a neighboring monastery
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.3.15_0: ʻGo and make amends for this offense. When you return, we’ll make amends for it in your presence.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.3.16_0: If this works out, all is well.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.3.17_0: If not, then a competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.3.18_0: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.3.19_0: This whole sangha has committed the same offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.3.20_0: When one doesn’t see another monk, he’ll make amends for that offense.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.3.21_0: They should then do the invitation procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.3.22_0: You shouldn’t allow this to create an obstacle to the doing of the invitation procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.3.23_0: “On the invitation day it may happen that the whole sangha in a certain monastery is unsure if it has committed the same offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.3.24_0: A competent and capable monk should then inform the Sangha:
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.3.25_0: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.3.26_0: This whole sangha is unsure if it has committed the same offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.3.27_0: When the Sangha is sure, it should make amends for this offense.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.3.28_0: Once this has been said, they can do the invitation procedure. You shouldn’t allow this to create an obstacle to the doing of the invitation procedure.”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:6.3.29_0: The first recitation section is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.1.1_0: At one time on the invitation day five or more resident monks had gathered in a certain monastery.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.1.3_0: that there were other resident monks who had not arrived.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.1.4_0: Perceiving that they were acting according to the Teaching and the Monastic Law, perceiving that the assembly was complete although it was not, they did the invitation procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.1.5_0: During the procedure a greater number of resident monks arrived.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.2.1_0: “On the invitation day it may happen that five or more resident monks have gathered in a certain monastery.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.2.3_0: that there are other resident monks who haven’t arrived.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.2.4_0: Perceiving that they’re acting according to the Teaching and the Monastic Law, perceiving that the assembly is complete although it’s not, they do the invitation procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.2.5_0: During the procedure a greater number of resident monks arrive.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.2.6_0: In such a case those monks should do the invitation procedure once more.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.2.7_0: And there’s no offense for those who already have invited.”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.3.1_0: “On the invitation day it may happen that five or more resident monks have gathered in a certain monastery.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.3.3_0: that there are other resident monks who haven’t arrived.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.3.4_0: Perceiving that they’re acting according to the Teaching and the Monastic Law, perceiving that the assembly is complete although it’s not, they do the invitation procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.3.5_0: During the procedure, an equal number of resident monks arrive.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.3.6_0: In such a case the invitations of those who already have invited are valid, but the others should invite.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.3.7_0: And there’s no offense for those who already have invited.”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.3.8_0: “On the invitation day it may happen that five or more resident monks have gathered in a certain monastery.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.3.10_0: that there are other resident monks who haven’t arrived.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.3.11_0: Perceiving that they’re acting according to the Teaching and the Monastic Law, perceiving that the assembly is complete although it’s not, they do the invitation procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.3.12_0: During the procedure a smaller number of resident monks arrive.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.3.13_0: In such a case the invitations of those who already have invited are valid, but the others should invite.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.3.14_0: And there’s no offense for those who already have invited.”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.4.1_0: “On the invitation day it may happen that five or more resident monks have gathered in a certain monastery.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.4.3_0: that there are other resident monks who haven’t arrived.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.4.4_0: Perceiving that they’re acting according to the Teaching and the Monastic Law, perceiving that the assembly is complete although it’s not, they do the invitation procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.4.5_0: When they’ve just finished, a greater number of resident monks arrive.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.4.6_0: In such a case those monks should do the invitation procedure once more.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.4.7_0: And there’s no offense for those who already have invited.”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.4.8_0: “On the invitation day it may happen that five or more resident monks have gathered in a certain monastery.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.4.10_0: that there are other resident monks who haven’t arrived.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.4.11_0: Perceiving that they’re acting according to the Teaching and the Monastic Law, perceiving that the assembly is complete although it’s not, they do the invitation procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.4.12_0: When they’ve just finished, an equal number of resident monks arrive.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.4.13_0: In such a case the invitations of those who already have invited are valid, and the late arrivals should invite in the presence of the others.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.4.14_0: And there’s no offense for those who already have invited.”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.4.15_0: “On the invitation day it may happen that five or more resident monks have gathered in a certain monastery.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.4.17_0: that there are other resident monks who haven’t arrived.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.4.18_0: Perceiving that they’re acting according to the Teaching and the Monastic Law, perceiving that the assembly is complete although it’s not, they do the invitation procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.4.19_0: When they’ve just finished, a smaller number of resident monks arrive.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.4.20_0: In such a case the invitations of those who already have invited are valid, and the late arrivals should invite in the presence of the others.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.4.21_0: And there’s no offense for those who already have invited.”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.5.1_0: “On the invitation day it may happen that five or more resident monks have gathered in a certain monastery.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.5.3_0: that there are other resident monks who haven’t arrived.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.5.4_0: Perceiving that they’re acting according to the Teaching and the Monastic Law, perceiving that the assembly is complete although it’s not, they do the invitation procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.5.5_0: When they’ve just finished, and none of the gathering has left, a greater number of resident monks arrive.

ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.5.7_0: And there’s no offense for those who already have invited.”

ai-pli-tv-kd4:7.5.24_0: that there are other resident monks who haven’t arrived.

ai-pli-tv-kd4:11.2.108_0: They think, ʻMay they get lost! May they disappear! Who needs them?’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:11.2.109_0: And aiming at schism, they do the invitation procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:11.2.110_0: When they’ve just finished, and the entire gathering has left, a smaller number of resident monks arrive.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:11.2.111_0: In such a case the invitations of those who already have invited are valid, and the late arrivals should invite in the presence of the others.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:11.2.112_0: And there’s a serious offense for those who already have invited.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:11.2.113_0: The group of fifteen on aiming at schism is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:11.2.114_0: The group of seventy-five is finished.

ai-pli-tv-kd4:12.1.12_0: As there are one hundred and seventy-five sets of three for resident monks with resident monks, so there is for newly arrived monks with resident monks, resident monks with newly arrived monks, newly arrived monks with newly arrived monks. Thus by way of succession, there are seven hundred sets of three.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:13.1.1_0: “It may happen that for the resident monks it’s the fourteenth day of the lunar half-month, but for the newly arrived monks it’s the fifteenth. Then—
ai-pli-tv-kd4:13.1.2_0: If the number of resident monks is greater, the newly arrived monks should fall in line with resident monks.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:13.1.3_0: If the number is the same, the newly arrived monks should fall in line with resident monks.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:13.1.4_0: If the number of newly arrived monks is greater, the resident monks should fall in line with the newly arrived monks.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:13.1.5_0: “It may happen that for the resident monks it’s the fifteenth day of the lunar half-month, but for the newly arrived monks it’s the fourteenth. Then—
ai-pli-tv-kd4:13.1.6_0: If the number of resident monks is greater, the newly arrived monks should fall in line with resident monks.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:13.1.7_0: If the number is the same, the newly arrived monks should fall in line with resident monks.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:13.1.8_0: If the number of newly arrived monks is greater, the resident monks should fall in line with the newly arrived monks.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:13.1.9_0: “It may happen that for the resident monks it’s the day after the observance day, but for the newly arrived monks it’s the fifteenth day of the lunar half-month. Then—
ai-pli-tv-kd4:13.1.10_0: If the number of resident monks is greater, the resident monks may, if they’re willing, do the observance-day procedure with the newly arrived monks.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:13.1.11_0: Otherwise the newly arrived monks should go outside the monastic boundary and do the invitation procedure there.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:13.1.12_0: If the number is the same, the resident monks may, if they’re willing, do the invitation procedure with the newly arrived monks.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:13.1.13_0: Otherwise the newly arrived monks should go outside the monastic boundary and do the invitation procedure there.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:13.1.14_0: If the number of newly arrived monks is greater, the resident monks should do the observance-day procedure with the newly arrived monks, or they should go outside the monastic boundary while the newly arrived monks do the observance-day procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:13.1.15_0: “It may happen that for the resident monks it’s the fifteenth day of the lunar half-month, but for the newly arrived monks it’s the day after the observance day. Then—
ai-pli-tv-kd4:13.1.16_0: If the number of resident monks is greater, the newly arrived monks should do the invitation procedure with the resident monks, or they should go outside the monastic boundary while the resident monks do the invitation procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:13.1.17_0: If the number is the same, the newly arrived monks should do the invitation procedure with the resident monks, or they should go outside the monastic boundary while the resident monks do the invitation procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:13.1.18_0: If the number of newly arrived monks is greater, they may, if they’re willing, do the observance-day procedure with the resident monks.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:13.1.19_0: Otherwise the resident monks should go outside the monastic boundary and do the invitation procedure there.”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:13.1.20.1_0: “It may happen that newly arrived monks see signs and indications of resident monks: beds and benches have been made up, water for drinking and water for washing have been put out, precincts are well-swept.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:13.1.21_0: As a consequence, they think there may be resident monks there, but they’re unsure. Then—
ai-pli-tv-kd4:13.1.22_0: If they don’t investigate, and they then do the invitation procedure, there’s an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:13.1.23_0: If they do investigate, but they don’t see anyone, and they then do the invitation procedure, there’s no offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:13.1.24_0: If they do investigate, and they do see someone, and they then do the invitation procedure together, there’s no offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:13.1.25_0: If they do investigate, and they do see someone, and they then do the invitation procedure separately, there’s an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:13.1.26_0: They do investigate, and they do see someone, but they think, ʻMay they get lost! May they disappear! Who needs them?’ and they then do the invitation procedure aiming at schism.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:13.1.27_0: “It may happen that newly arrived monks hear signs and indications of resident monks: the sound of the feet of someone walking up and down, the sound of recitation, the sound of coughing, the sound of sneezing.

ai-pli-tv-kd4:13.1.48.1_0: “It may happen that newly arrived monks see resident monks who belong to a different Buddhist sect.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:13.1.49_0: But they have the view that they belong to the same Buddhist sect. In that case:
ai-pli-tv-kd4:13.1.50_0: If they don’t ask the resident monks about it, and they do the invitation procedure together, there’s no offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:13.1.51_0: If they do ask the newly arrived monks about it, but they don’t reach a clear conclusion, and they then do the invitation procedure together, there’s an offense of wrong conduct.

ai-pli-tv-kd4:14.1.0_0: seeing the faults of the Buddha,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:14.1.1_0: “You shouldn’t do the invitation procedure with a nun seated in the gathering.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:14.1.2_0: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:14.1.3_0: You shouldn’t recite the Monastic Code with a trainee nun,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:14.1.6_0: one who has renounced the training,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:14.1.7_0: or one who has committed the worst kind of offense seated in the gathering.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:14.1.8_0: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:14.2.1_0: You shouldn’t do the invitation procedure with one who has been ejected for not recognizing an offense seated in the gathering.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:14.2.2_0: If you do, you should be dealt with according to the rule.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:14.2.3_0: You shouldn’t do the invitation procedure with one who has been ejected for not making amends for an offense seated in the gathering
ai-pli-tv-kd4:14.2.4_0: or with one who has been ejected for not giving up a bad view seated in the gathering.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:14.2.5_0: If you do, you should be dealt with according to the rule.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:14.3.1_0: You shouldn’t do the invitation procedure with a _paṇḍaka_ seated in the gathering.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:14.3.2_0: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:14.3.3_0: You shouldn’t do the invitation procedure with one living in the community by theft,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:14.3.4_0: with one who has previously left to join the ascetics of another religion,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:14.3.8_0: with a murderer of a perfected one,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:14.3.9_0: with one who has raped a nun,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:14.3.10_0: with one has caused a schism in the Sangha,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:14.3.11_0: with one who has caused a Buddha to bleed,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:14.3.12_0: or with a hermaphrodite seated in the gathering.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:14.3.13_0: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:14.4.1_0: “You shouldn’t do the invitation procedure with a regular monk on probation while on probation.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:14.4.2_0: You shouldn’t do the invitation procedure on a non-invitation day, except for the purpose of the unity of the Sangha.”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:14.4.3_0: The second recitation section is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.1.1_0: At one time on the invitation day in a certain monastery in the Kosalan country there was danger from aboriginals.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.1.2_0: The monks were not able to do the invitation procedure by means of three statements.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.1.4_0: “I allow you to do the invitation procedure by means of two statements.”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.1.5_0: and the dangerous Bāhiya became fearful.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.1.6_0: The monks were not able to do the invitation procedure by means of two statements.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.1.8_0: “I allow you to do the invitation procedure by means of one statement.”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.1.9_0: and the dangerous Bāhiya became fearful.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.1.10_0: The monks were not able to do the invitation procedure by means of one statement.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.1.12_0: “I allow you to do the invitation procedure in groups according to year of seniority.”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.2.1_0: On one occasion on the invitation day in a certain monastery, most of the night was used up by people making offerings.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.2.3_0: “Most of the night has been used up by people making offerings.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.2.4_0: If the Sangha does the invitation procedure by means of three statements, it will not be finished before dawn.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.2.5_0: So what should we do now?”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.3.2_0: If they consider this and think,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.3.3_0: ‘In the night, when people have been used up by people making offerings,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.3.4_0: a competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.3.5_0: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.3.6_0: Most of the night has been used up by people making offerings.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.3.7_0: If the Sangha does the invitation procedure by means of three statements, it will not be finished before dawn.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.3.8_0: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should do the invitation procedure by means of two statements or by means of one statement or in groups according to year of seniority.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.4.1_0: “It may happen on the invitation day in a certain monastery that most of the night is used up by monks giving teachings,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.4.2_0: by experts on the discourses reciting discourses together,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.4.3_0: by experts on the Monastic Law deliberating on the Monastic Law together,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.4.4_0: by expounders of the Teaching discussing the Teaching,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.4.6_0: If they consider this and think,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.4.7_0: ‘Mother, you have used to make offerings by night.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.4.8_0: a competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.4.9_0: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.4.10_0: Most of the night has been used up by monks arguing.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.4.11_0: If the Sangha does the invitation procedure by means of three statements, it will not be finished before dawn.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.4.12_0: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should do the invitation procedure by means of two statements or by means of one statement or in groups according to year of seniority.’”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.5.1_0: At one time on the invitation day in a certain monastery in the Kosalan country a large sangha of monks had gathered. A storm was approaching, but they only had a small area that was sheltered.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.5.3_0: “This large Sangha of monks has gathered. A storm is approaching, but we only have a small area that’s sheltered.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.5.4_0: If the Sangha does the invitation procedure by means of three statements, it will not be finished before it starts raining.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.5.5_0: So what should we do now?”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.6.2_0: If they consider this and think,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.6.3_0: ‘This large Sangha of monks has gathered. A storm is approaching, but we only have a small area that’s sheltered.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.6.4_0: If the Sangha does the invitation procedure by means of three statements, it will not be finished before it starts raining.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.6.5_0: A competent and capable monk should then inform the Sangha:
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.6.6_0: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.6.7_0: This large Sangha of monks has gathered. A storm is approaching, but we only have a small area that’s sheltered.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.6.8_0: If the Sangha does the invitation procedure by means of three statements, it will not be finished before it starts raining.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.6.9_0: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should do the invitation procedure by means of two statements or by means of one statement or in groups according to year of seniority.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.7.1_0: “It may happen on the invitation day in a certain monastery that there is danger from kings,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.7.9_0: or there is a life-threatening danger
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.7.10_0: or a danger to living the spiritual life.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.7.11_0: If they consider this and think,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.7.12_0: ‘This is the danger to living the spiritual life.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.7.13_0: and think, ‘This is a danger to living the spiritual life. If the Sangha does the invitation procedure by means of three statements, we won’t be finished before the danger manifests,’ then a competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.7.14_0: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.7.15_0: this is the danger of the spiritual life.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.7.16_0: If the Sangha does the invitation procedure by means of three statements, it will not be finished before the danger manifests.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:15.7.17_0: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should do the invitation procedure by means of two statements or by means of one statement or in groups according to year of seniority.’”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.1.1_0: At that time the monks from the group of six invited correction while having uncleared offenses.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.1.3_0: “You should not invite correction if you have uncleared offenses.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.1.4_0: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.1.5_0: If anyone invites correction with uncleared offenses, you should get their permission and then accuse them of an offense.”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.2.1_0: Soon afterwards, when asked for permission to be corrected, the monks from the group of six did not wish to give it.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.2.3_0: “If anyone doesn’t give their permission to be corrected, you should cancel their invitation.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.2.4_0: And it should be canceled like this.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.2.5_0: On the invitation day of the fourteenth or the fifteenth, in the midst of the Sangha and in the presence of that person:
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.2.6_0: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.2.7_0: Such-and-such a person has uncleared offenses.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.2.8_0: I’m canceling the invitation procedure of him.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.2.9_0: The invitation procedure should not be done in their presence.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.2.10_0: Their invitation has then been canceled.”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.3.2_0: that the good monks had invited him to appointment,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.3.3_0: but having no grounds or reasons—canceled the invitation of pure monks who had not committed any offenses. They also canceled the invitation of those who already had invited.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.3.5_0: “When there are no grounds or reasons, you should not cancel the invitation of pure monks who haven’t committed any offenses.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.3.6_0: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.3.7_0: And you should not cancel the invitation of those who already have invited.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.3.8_0: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.4.1_0: That’s how there is the invitation procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.4.2_0: And how does the invitation procedure?
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.4.3_0: If the invitation is canceled after a three-statement invitation has been spoken and concluded, then it’s not canceled.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.4.4_0: If the invitation is canceled when a two-statement invitation ...
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.4.6_0: after an invitation done in groups according to the year of seniority has been spoken and concluded, then it’s not canceled.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.4.7_0: That’s how there are eight invitation procedures.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.4.8_0: And how does the invitation procedure cancellation?
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.5.1_0: If the invitation is canceled when a three-statement invitation hasn’t yet been concluded, then it’s canceled.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.5.2_0: If the invitation is canceled when a two-statement invitation ...
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.5.4_0: when an invitation done in groups according to the year of seniority hasn’t yet been concluded, then it’s canceled.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.5.5_0: That’s how the invitation has been canceled.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.6.1_0: “It may happen on the invitation day that a monk cancels a second monk’s invitation.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.6.2_0: If other monks know about the first monk:
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.6.3_0: ‘This venerable is impure in bodily conduct, verbal conduct, and livelihood; he’s ignorant and incompetent, incapable of answering properly when questioned,’ then they should press him by saying, ‘Enough. No more arguing and disputing,’ and the Sangha should then do the invitation procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.7.1_0: “It may happen on the invitation day that a monk cancels a second monk’s invitation.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.7.2_0: If other monks know about the first monk:
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.7.3_0: ‘This venerable is pure in bodily conduct, but impure in verbal conduct and livelihood; he’s ignorant and incompetent, incapable of answering properly when questioned,’ then they should press him by saying, ‘Enough. No more arguing and disputing,’ and the Sangha should then do the invitation procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.8.1_0: “It may happen on the invitation day that a monk cancels a second monk’s invitation.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.8.2_0: If other monks know about the first monk:
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.8.3_0: ‘This venerable is pure in bodily conduct, but impure in verbal conduct and livelihood; he’s ignorant and incompetent, incapable of answering properly when questioned,’ then they should press him by saying, ‘Enough. No more arguing and disputing,’ and the Sangha should then do the invitation procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.9.1_0: “It may happen on the invitation day that a monk cancels a second monk’s invitation.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.9.2_0: If other monks know about the first monk:
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.9.3_0: ‘This venerable is pure in bodily conduct, verbal conduct, and livelihood; but he’s ignorant and incompetent, incapable of answering properly when questioned,’ then they should press him by saying, ‘Enough. No more arguing and disputing,’ and the Sangha should then do the invitation procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.10.1_0: “It may happen on the invitation day that a monk cancels a second monk’s invitation.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.10.2_0: If other monks know about the first monk:
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.10.3_0: ‘This venerable is pure in bodily conduct, verbal conduct, and livelihood; and he’s knowledgeable and competent, capable of answering properly when questioned,’ then they should say to him, ‘Are you canceling this monk’s invitation because he has failed in morality, in conduct, or in view?’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.11.2_0: ‘I’m canceling it because he has failed in morality’, ‘I’m canceling it because he has failed in conduct’, ‘I’m canceling it because he has failed in view,’ he should be asked,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.11.3_0: ‘Do you know what failure in morality is?’ ‘do you know what failure in conduct is?’ ‘do you know what failure in view is?’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.11.5_0: ‘I do,’ he should be asked what they are.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.11.6_0: ‘How is failure in morality? What is failure in conduct?’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.12.2_0: ‘The four offenses entailing expulsion and the thirteen entailing suspension are failure in morality,’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.12.3_0: but an offense entailing confession for a serious offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.12.5_0: ‘Are you canceling this monk’s invitation because of what you have seen, because of what you have heard, or because of suspicion?’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.13.2_0: ‘I’m canceling it because of what I have seen’, ‘I’m canceling it because of what I have heard’, ‘I’m canceling it because of suspicion,’ he should be asked,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.13.3_0: ‘Since you’re canceling this monk’s invitation because of what you have seen, what have you seen? How did you see it? When did you see it? Where did you see it? Did you see him commit an offense entailing expulsion? Did you see him commit an offense entailing suspension?
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.13.8_0: committing an offense of wrong speech. And where did you see?’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.14.2_0: ‘I didn’t cancel this monk’s invitation because of what I have seen, but because of what I have heard,’ he should be asked,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.14.3_0: ‘Since you’re canceling this monk’s invitation because of what you have heard, what have you heard? When did you hear it?
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.14.4_3: You’ve committed an offense of wrong speech.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.14.5_0: Did you hear it from a monk? Did you hear it from a nun? Did you hear it from a trainee nun? Did you hear it from a novice monk? Did you hear it from a novice nun? Did you hear it from a male lay follower? Did you hear it from a female lay follower? Did you hear it from kings? Did you hear it from a king’s officials? Did you hear it from the ascetics of another religion? Did you hear it from the lay followers of another religion?’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.15.1_0: If he cancels this monk, he should be asked,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.15.2_0: ‘Since you’re canceling this monk’s invitation because of suspicion, what do you suspect? How do you suspect it? When did you suspect it? Where did you suspect it?
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.15.3_0: Do you suspect that he has committed an offense entailing expulsion? Do you suspect that he has committed an offense entailing suspension? ... a serious offense?
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.15.3_4: Do you suspect that he has committed an offense of wrong speech?
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.15.4_0: Do you suspect it after hearing about it from a monk? Do you suspect it after hearing about it from a nun? Do you suspect it after hearing about it from a trainee nun? Do you suspect it after hearing about it from a novice monk? Do you suspect it after hearing about it from a novice nun? Do you suspect it after hearing about it from a male lay follower? Do you suspect it after hearing about it from a female lay follower? Do you suspect it after hearing about it from kings? Do you suspect it after hearing about it from a king’s officials? Do you suspect it after hearing about it from the ascetics of another religion? Do you suspect it after hearing about it from the lay followers of another religion?’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.16.2_0: ‘I don’t cancel this monk’s invitation because of suspicion, but because I don’t know it.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.16.3_0: “If the accusing monk, when questioned, isn’t able to satisfy his discerning fellow monastics, they should conclude, ‘The accused monk is improperly accused.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.16.4_0: “If the accusing monk, when questioned, is able to satisfy his discerning fellow monastics, they should conclude, ‘The accused mendicant is improperly accused.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.17.1_0: If the accusing monk admits to a groundless charge of an offense entailing expulsion, he should be charged with an offense entailing suspension. The Sangha should then do the invitation procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.17.2_0: If the accusing monk admits to a groundless charge of an offense entailing suspension, he should be dealt with according to the rule. The Sangha should then do the invitation procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.17.3_0: If the accusing monk admits to a groundless charge of a serious offense,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.17.7_0: or an offense of wrong speech, he should be dealt with according to the rule. The Sangha should then do the invitation procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.18.1_0: If the accused monk admits to having committed an offense entailing expulsion, he should be expelled. The Sangha should then do the invitation procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.18.2_0: If the accused monk admits to having committed an offense entailing suspension, he should be charged with that offense. The Sangha should then do the invitation procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.18.3_0: If the accused mendicant has been conveyed. ...
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.18.7_0: or an offense of wrong speech, he should be dealt with according to the rule. The Sangha should then do the invitation procedure.”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.19.1_0: “It may happen on the invitation day that a monk has committed a serious offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.19.2_0: Some monks regard it as a serious offense, but others as an offense entailing suspension.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.19.3_0: The monks who regard it as a serious offense should take that monk to one side and deal with him according to the rule. They should then approach the Sangha and say:
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.19.5_0: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should do the invitation procedure.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.20.1_0: “It may happen on the invitation day that a monk has committed a serious offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.20.2_0: Some monks regard it as a serious offense, but others as an offense entailing confession ...
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.20.3_0: Some monks regard it as a serious offense, but others as an offense entailing acknowledgment ...
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.20.4_0: Some monks regard it as a serious offense, but others as an offense of wrong conduct ...
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.20.5_0: Some monks regard it as a serious offense, but others as an offense of wrong speech.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.20.6_0: The monks who regard it as a serious offense should take that monk to one side and deal with him according to the rule. They should then approach the Sangha and say:
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.20.8_0: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should do the invitation procedure.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.21.1_0: “It may happen on the invitation day that a monk has committed an offense entailing confession,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.21.5_0: Some monks regard it as an offense of wrong speech, but others as an offense entailing suspension.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.21.6_0: The monks who regard it as an offense of wrong speech should take that monk to one side and deal with him according to the rule. They should then approach the Sangha and say:
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.21.8_0: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should do the invitation procedure.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.22.1_0: “It may happen on the invitation day that a monk has committed an offense of wrong speech.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.22.2_0: Some monks regard it as an offense of wrong speech, but others as a serious offense ...
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.22.3_0: Some monks regard it as an offense of wrong speech, but others as an offense entailing confession ...
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.22.4_0: Some monks regard it as an offense of wrong speech, but others as an offense entailing acknowledgment ...
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.22.5_0: Some monks regard it as an offense of wrong speech, but others as an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.22.6_0: The monks who regard it as an offense of wrong speech should take that monk to one side and deal with him according to the rule. They should then approach the Sangha and say:
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.22.8_0: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should do the invitation procedure.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.23.1_0: “On the invitation day it may happen that a monk is expounded or in the midst of the Sangha:
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.23.2_0: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.23.3_0: I know about an offense, but not who the offender is.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.23.4_0: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, it should set aside the offense and then do the invitation procedure.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.23.5_0: You should say this to them,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.23.6_0: ‘The Buddha has laid down a rule that the invitation procedure is for monks who are pure.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.23.7_0: If you know the offense, but not the offender, then say now who it is that you suspect.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.24.1_0: “On the invitation day it may happen that a monk is expounded or in the midst of the Sangha:
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.24.2_0: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.24.3_0: I know of an offender, but not what the offense is.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.24.4_0: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, it should do the invitation procedure without the offender.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.24.5_0: You should say this to them,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.24.6_0: ‘The Buddha has laid down a rule that the invitation procedure should be done in a complete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.24.7_0: If you know the offender, but not the offense, then say now what it is that you suspect.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.25.1_0: “On the invitation day it may happen that a monk is expounded or in the midst of the Sangha:
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.25.2_0: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.25.3_0: I know an offender and his offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.25.4_0: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, it should set aside the offense and then do the invitation procedure without the offender.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.25.5_0: You should say this to them,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.25.6_0: ‘The Buddha has laid down a rule that the invitation procedure should be done in a complete assembly by monks who are pure.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.25.7_0: If you know an offender and his offense, then say now who and what it is.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.26.1_0: “If the offense is known about before the invitation procedure, but the offender only afterwards, the offender should be corrected.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.26.2_0: If the offender is known about before the invitation procedure, but the offense only afterwards, the offender should be corrected.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:16.26.3_0: If both the offense and the offender are known about before the invitation procedure, and someone reopens the case after the invitation procedure has been done, he commits an offense entailing confession for the reopening.”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.1.1_0: At that time in a certain monastery in the Kosalan country a number of monks who were friends had entered rainy-season residence together.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.1.2_0: Other monks who were quarrelsome, argumentative, and creators of legal issues in the Sangha had entered the rains residence nearby. These monks said to one another,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.1.3_0: “At the invitation procedure, when those monks have completed the rains residence, we’ll cancel their invitation.”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.1.4_0: The monks who were friends heard about this
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.1.5_0: “It seems that other monks who were quarrelsome and argumentative, and creators of legal issues in the Sangha had entered the rains residence nearby.”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.1.6_0: ‘At the invitation procedure, when those monks have completed the rains residence, we’ll cancel their invitation.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.1.7_0: So what should we do now?”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.2.1_0: “It may happen that a number of monks who are friends entered the rainy-season residence together.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.2.2_0: Other monks who were quarrelsome, argumentative, and creators of legal issues in the Sangha had entered the rains residence nearby. These monks said to one another,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.2.3_0: ‘At the invitation procedure, when those monks have completed the rains residence, we’ll cancel their invitation.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.2.4_0: I allow those monks to do two or three observance-day ceremonies on the fourteenth
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.2.5_0: with the aim of having their invitation procedure before the other monks.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.2.6_0: “If those quarrelsome and argumentative monks are on their way to the other monastery, the resident monks should gather quickly and do the invitation procedure. When it has been done, they should say to the other monks,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.2.8_0: please do whatever you think is appropriate.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.3.1_0: “If those quarrelsome and argumentative monks are quarrelsome, argumentative, and creators of legal issues in the Sangha, they should go out to meet them to receive their bowl and robe, and then put out water for drinking and water for washing the feet. They should prepare a seat for washing the feet.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.3.2_0: When the other monk’s put outside the monastic boundary, he should go outside the monastic boundary and do the invitation procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.3.4_0: please do whatever you think is appropriate.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.4.1_0: If this works out, all is well.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.4.2_0: If not, then a competent and capable monk should inform the resident monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.4.3_0: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the resident monks to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.4.4_0: If it seems appropriate to the venerables, we will now do the observance-day procedure by reciting the Monastic Code, and we will do the invitation procedure at the next new moon.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.4.5_0: If the quarrelsome and argumentative monks are quarrelsome, argumentative, and creators of legal issues in the Sangha, they should say,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.4.6_0: ‘It would be good if you would do the invitation procedure with us now,’ they should be told,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.4.7_0: ‘You have no authority over our invitation procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.4.8_0: We won’t do the invitation procedure for one who has returned.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.5.1_0: “If those quarrelsome and argumentative monks are quarrelsome, argumentative, and creators of legal issues in the Sangha, they should inform those monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.5.2_0: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the resident monks to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.5.3_0: If it seems appropriate to the venerables, we will now do the observance-day procedure by reciting the Monastic Code, and we will do the invitation procedure at the next new moon.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.5.4_0: If the quarrelsome and argumentative monks are quarrelsome, argumentative, and creators of legal issues in the Sangha, they should say,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.5.5_0: ‘It would be good if you would do the invitation procedure with us now,’ they should be told,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.5.6_0: ‘You have no authority over our invitation procedure. We won’t do the procedure for the time being.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.6.1_0: If the quarrelsome and argumentative monks stay on even until the next full moon, then all the monks have no choice but to do the invitation procedure on the day of Komudī, the fourth full moon of the rainy season.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.7.1_0: If, while you’re doing the invitation procedure, a sick monk cancels the invitation of a healthy monk, you should tell him,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.7.3_0: The Buddha has said that a sick monk can’t endure being questioned.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.7.5_0: If you then wish, you may accuse him.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.7.6_0: If, in spite of this, he still accuses the other, he commits an offense entailing confession for disrespect.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.8.1_0: If, while you’re doing the invitation procedure, a healthy monk cancels the invitation of a sick monk, you should tell him,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.8.3_0: The Buddha has said that a sick monk can’t endure being questioned.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.8.5_0: If you then wish, you may accuse him.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.8.6_0: If, in spite of this, he still accuses the other, he commits an offense entailing confession for disrespect.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.9.1_0: If, while you’re doing the invitation procedure, a sick monk cancels the invitation of a sick monk, you should tell him,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.9.3_0: The Buddha has said that a sick monk can’t endure being questioned.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.9.5_0: If you then wish, you may accuse him.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.9.6_0: If, in spite of this, he still accuses the other, he commits an offense entailing confession for disrespect.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:17.10.1_0: If, while you’re doing the invitation procedure, a healthy monk cancels the invitation of a healthy monk, you should question and examine both and deal with them according to the rule. The Sangha should then continue the invitation procedure.”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:18.1.1_0: At that time in a certain monastery in the Kosalan country a number of monks who were friends had entered rainy-season residence together.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:18.1.2_0: While dwelling in unity and harmony, they have attained a certain pleasant state of meditation.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:18.1.4_0: “In concording to unity and harmony, we have attained a certain pleasant state of meditation.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:18.1.5_0: If we do the invitation procedure now, the monks might leave to go wandering.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:18.1.6_0: We will then have lost this pleasant abiding.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:18.1.7_0: So what should we do now?”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:18.2.1_0: “It may happen that a number of monks who are friends entered the rainy-season residence together.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:18.2.2_0: While dwelling in unity and harmony, they have attained a certain pleasant state of meditation.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:18.2.3_0: If they consider this and think,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:18.2.4_0: ‘I’ve attained a certain pleasant state of meditation in unity and harmony,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:18.2.5_0: If we do the invitation procedure now, the monks might leave to go wandering.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:18.2.6_0: We will then have lost this pleasant abiding.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:18.2.7_0: I allow those monks to make an agreement about the invitation procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:18.3.1_0: And it should be done like this.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:18.3.2_0: Everyone should gather in one place.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:18.3.3_0: A competent and capable monk should then inform the Sangha:
ai-pli-tv-kd4:18.3.4_0: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:18.3.5_0: While dwelling in unity and harmony, we have attained a certain pleasant state of meditation.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:18.3.6_0: If we do the invitation procedure now, the monks might leave to go wandering.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:18.3.7_0: We will then have lost this pleasant abiding.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:18.3.8_0: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should make an agreement about the invitation procedure: we will now do the observance-day procedure by reciting the Monastic Code, and we will do the invitation procedure on the day of Komudī, the fourth full moon of the rainy season.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:18.4.1_0: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:18.4.2_0: While dwelling in unity and harmony, we have attained a certain pleasant state of meditation.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:18.4.3_0: If we do the invitation procedure now, the monks might leave to go wandering.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:18.4.4_0: We will then have lost this pleasant abiding.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:18.4.5_0: The Sangha makes an agreement about the invitation procedure: we will now do the observance-day procedure by reciting the Monastic Code, and we will do the invitation procedure on the day of Komudī, the fourth full moon of the rainy season.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:18.4.6_0: Any monk who approves of doing the invitation procedure: we will now do the observance-day procedure by reciting the Monastic Code, and we will do the invitation procedure on the day of Komudī, the fourth full moon of the rainy season, and should remain silent.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:18.4.7_0: Any monk who doesn’t agree should speak up.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:18.4.8_0: The Sangha has done the invitation procedure: we will now do the observance-day procedure by reciting the Monastic Code, and we will do the invitation procedure on the day of Komudī, the fourth full moon of the rainy season.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:18.4.9_0: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I will remember it thus.’”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:18.5.1_0: “If, when those monks have made an agreement about the invitation procedure, a monk says,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:18.5.2_0: ‘I wish to go wandering in the country;
ai-pli-tv-kd4:18.5.3_0: I have something to do there,’ they should tell him,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:18.5.4_0: ‘That’s fine, but you have to do the invitation first.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:18.5.5_0: If, while that monk is doing the invitation, he cancels the invitation of another monk, the other monk should tell him,
ai-pli-tv-kd4:18.5.6_0: ‘You have no authority over my invitation until I invite.’
ai-pli-tv-kd4:18.5.7_0: If, while that monk is doing the invitation, another monk cancels his invitation, the monks should question and examine both and deal with them according to the rule.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:18.6.1_0: If that monk returns to Komudī on business, then those monks should ask him about his invitation.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:18.6.2_0: ‘You have no authority over my invitation procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:18.6.4_0: If, while the monks are doing the invitation procedure, the monk who has returned cancels the invitation of another monk, the monks should question and examine both and deal with them according to the rule. The Sangha should then continue the invitation procedure.”
ai-pli-tv-kd4:18.6.5_0: The fourth chapter on the invitation procedure is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:18.6.7_0: When they had completed the rains residence in the Kosalan country
ai-pli-tv-kd4:18.6.8_0: and went to see the Teacher.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:18.6.19_0: the fourteenth day of the fortnight.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:18.6.20_0: are bothered by the power of the animal.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:18.6.22_0: The invitation procedure has been done.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:18.6.24_0: between the invitation procedure and the invitation procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:18.6.28_0: what is seen, heard, and suspected.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:18.6.33_0: In this chapter there are forty-six topics.
ai-pli-tv-kd4:18.6.34_0: The chapter on the invitation procedure is finished.
